channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump and China's leader Xi Jinping hold a call and discuss trade, Taiwan and Ukraine
item.description: Monday's call was the latest in a flurry of diplomatic and trade parries between the U.S. and China over tariffs and technology export restrictions.
item.content:encoded:
Monday's call was the latest in a flurry of diplomatic and trade parries between the U.S. and China over tariffs and technology export restrictions.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Trump's peace plan for Ukraine. And, why Marjorie Taylor Greene is resigning
item.description: European leaders are skeptical of President Trump's peace plan for Ukraine. And, what led Marjorie Taylor Greene to announce she will resign from Congress next year.
item.content:encoded:
European leaders are skeptical of President Trump's peace plan for Ukraine. And, what led Marjorie Taylor Greene to announce she will resign from Congress next year.

(Image credit: Fabrice Coffrini)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: He left Gaza and fled to Europe on a jet ski. Now he hopes to bring his family
item.description: In an extraordinary journey, a Palestinian man used a jet ski to cross the Mediterranean Sea and reach Europe after he fled the war in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: In an extraordinary journey, a Palestinian man used a jet ski to cross the Mediterranean Sea and reach Europe after he fled the war in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Over 250 children still missing in Nigeria after being abducted from Catholic school
item.description: More than 250 children are still being held by kidnappers in central Nigeria after they were abducted Friday from a Catholic boarding school.
item.content:encoded: More than 250 children are still being held by kidnappers in central Nigeria after they were abducted Friday from a Catholic boarding school.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: European nations clamor to be involved in Ukraine peace talks, Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's resignation forces GOP to rethink its politics, Israel and Hamas accuse each other of violating ceasefire.
item.content:encoded: European nations clamor to be involved in Ukraine peace talks, Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's resignation forces GOP to rethink its politics, Israel and Hamas accuse each other of violating ceasefire.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: A tale of two Chinas: Tech industry booms as workers face dim prospects
item.description: In China, two economic realities exist side of by side. The country's fast-growing technology sector is now leading the world in some aspects. Yet prospects for the average Chinese worker remain dim.
item.content:encoded: In China, two economic realities exist side of by side. The country's fast-growing technology sector is now leading the world in some aspects. Yet prospects for the average Chinese worker remain dim.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Ukrainians express concerns about a peace plan drafted by the U.S. and Russia
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was given a Thursday deadline to accept a new peace plan drafted by the U.S. and Russia that Ukraine had no input in, causing concerns for residents.
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was given a Thursday deadline to accept a new peace plan drafted by the U.S. and Russia that Ukraine had no input in, causing concerns for residents.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: COP30 ends with agreement on adaptation funding but no mention of fossil fuels
item.description: World climate negotiations wrapped up over the weekend in Brazil with an agreement that increases money for countries to adapt to climate change but doesn't address phasing out fossil fuels.
item.content:encoded: World climate negotiations wrapped up over the weekend in Brazil with an agreement that increases money for countries to adapt to climate change but doesn't address phasing out fossil fuels.
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: European nations want more input in U.S.-backed plan to end Russia-Ukraine war
item.description: Top U.S. and Ukrainian officials said Sunday that they made progress toward ending the Russia-Ukraine war. But European allies feel they've been left out of the plan, which they say placates Russia.
item.content:encoded: Top U.S. and Ukrainian officials said Sunday that they made progress toward ending the Russia-Ukraine war. But European allies feel they've been left out of the plan, which they say placates Russia.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Lawmakers voice their concerns about U.S.-backed plan to end Ukraine war
item.description: The Trump administration says it has a peace plan to end the Russia-Ukraine war. But not all lawmakers, including Republicans, are convinced.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration says it has a peace plan to end the Russia-Ukraine war. But not all lawmakers, including Republicans, are convinced.
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett
